review.author: DevOps (Codex)
findings: Promotion Engine Phase 2: shared service layer unifies IPC and WebSocket access to contract promotion.
3 IPC channels (list/approve/reject) map through executeContractPromotionAction — signatures match.
WS routing in hivemind-app extracts action/payload/requestId — matches CLI message shape exactly.
CLI hm-promotion.js sends {type: contract-promotion, action, payload, requestId} — correct WS protocol.
requestId propagation verified: CLI → WS runtime → handler → response with matching requestId.
Split-brain mitigation: syncStatsFromDisk before reads, saveStats after mutations, checkPromotions merges disk+memory.
Handler registry wiring correct: registered in DEFAULT_HANDLERS, unregister cleanup on all 3 channels.
FLAG: normalize redundant call in invalid_action path (cosmetic). FLAG: race window in approve/reject acceptable (single-threaded, convergent merge).
3 test files cover service layer, IPC handlers, and CLI helpers. No blocking issues.

_docs.rule: If change_type !== 'routine', reviewer model MUST differ from author model
_docs.workflow: 1. Author fills author+author_model+change_type. 2. Reviewer fills reviewer+model+result+findings. 3. Pre-commit checks result=approved and cross-model rule. 4. After commit, review.json is reset to pending.
